meanings.definition: A person or thing that unloads.
meanings.sent1: The unloader helped move the heavy boxes off the truck.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse hired an unloader to assist with the deliveries.
meanings.sent3: The little robot unloader danced around the warehouse, unloading boxes with a smile.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an unloader, relieving the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The unloader's efficiency was unmatched, making the task seem effortless.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism for unloading.
meanings.sent1: The automatic unloader quickly emptied the contents of the container.
meanings.sent2: The conveyor belt acted as an unloader, transferring the goods to the next stage.
meanings.sent3: The unloader machine hummed a cheerful tune as it worked tirelessly.
meanings.sent4: The unloader operated smoothly, like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The unloader's precision was impressive, ensuring no item was left behind.

meanings.definition: A type of valve used to release pressure.
meanings.sent1: The unloader valve prevented the tank from overpressurizing.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic adjusted the unloader to regulate the air pressure.
meanings.sent3: The unloader valve sighed in relief as the excess pressure escaped.
meanings.sent4: The unloader valve acted as a safety net, protecting the system from damage.
meanings.sent5: The hiss of the unloader signaled the release of built-up pressure.
